channel.title: Holy shit this is retarded
channel.description:
God, who designs shit like this ? I'm trying to download the new JDK, and every time I do it prompts me to wether or not I want to remove the previous installation first. So when I click "yes", it starts removing the previous installation but then halfway through it starts again and tries to install it!
How the hell do I uninstall this thing ? I've deleted the regestry keys, I got rid of some of the files in the application data, I destroyed the folder, but its STILL in the list of programs installed.
How do I get rid of it?

item.title: Holy shit this is retarded
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Aha! I figured it out! Thanks to BobDole. Hey was right about the registry keys keeping me from installing it, but it wasn’t
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall,

it was

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\Install\Users

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Holy shit this is retarded

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Use the Add/Remove Software shet provided by microsoft?

item.title: Holy shit this is retarded

item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I deleted the registry key for it there, yet it still is saying I already have it installed… ffs

Read full topic

item.title: Holy shit this is retarded
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well simply to remove it from the installed programs list, you need to remove the corresponding registry key in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall

Dunno exactly what the issue is as I wouldn’t think the jdk install would specifically look for that registry key, but just see if that works.

And yes, this should be in placed in the Questions forum

Read full topic

item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Huh? Why is this in Java programming?
